properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 5:06AM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
At 5 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras
indicated that areas of fog had formed throughout east central
Florida. The fog was reducing visibilities to between 1 and 3 miles
across many areas, and below one half mile in some locations. the
fog had yet to reach Martin County and portions of Saint Lucie
County, but could develop in these areas before sunrise.

The fog will persist through about 9 AM. Should dense fog with
visibilities of less than one quarter mile become more widespread
then a Dense Fog Advisory will be issued.

If you will be out driving early this morning, you should plan on
leaving early, to allow yourself extra time to safely reach your
destination. When driving in dense fog, reduce your speed, use your
low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle
and the one in front of you.

NWSheadline: Areas of Fog have Developed Across East Central Florida, Locally Dense in Some Locations
